front.title: DNS Request and Transaction Signatures ( SIG(0)s )

abstract.t: Extensions to the Domain Name System (DNS) are described in [RFC2535] that can provide data origin and transaction integrity andauthentication to security aware resolvers and applications throughthe use of cryptographic digital signatures.Implementation experience has indicated the need for minor but non-interoperable changes in Request and Transaction signature resourcerecords ( SIG(0)s ). These changes are documented herein.
